library(tidyverse)

#data
```{r}
in_data <- open_dataset(sources = file.path("D:", "Shared drives", "Hansen Lab", "RESEARCH PROJECTS", "Fish Survey Data", "Parquet files", "hive"), partitioning = c("state")) %>% 
  filter(state == "Indiana")
glimpse(in_data)

in_data %>% 
  group_by(sampling_method, sampling_method_2) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  collect() %>% 
  print(n = nrow(.))

in_data %>% 
  group_by(target_species, target_species_2) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  collect() %>% 
  print(n = nrow(.))

in_data %>% 
  group_by(survey_type) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  collect() %>% 
  print(n=nrow(.))
#looks like sampling method and survey type are good
#all targeted species are in target species 1 - string detect with captical letters at beginning of word and space
```

#filtering walleye
```{r}
filter_table_effort <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vSkGZinLPrSuv1DorBrAkV2JNUZsOlpG7jk_WsnGyZX56z9JMVcGHdCPlsxInjOdjUH0tXb4nBwt9Js/pub?output=csv") %>% 
  filter(metric == "adult_abundance" & state == "Indiana" & species_1 == "walleye") %>% 
  select(-metric,
         -species_1,
         -water_temp_min,
         -water_temp_max,
         -area_group)

good_surveys <- in_data %>% 
  #creating a y or n for if we could even expect the species to be present in the survey
  mutate(species_included = case_when(grepl("Walleye", target_species) | is.na(target_species) ~ "y",
                                      TRUE ~ "n")) %>% 
  right_join(filter_table_effort, by = c("state",
                                        "sampling_method",
                                        "survey_type")) %>% 
  distinct(lake_id,
           sampling_method,
           survey_type,
           month,
           total_effort_1,
           total_effort_1_units,
           total_effort_ident,
           effort_min,
           month_min,
           month_max,
           species_included)%>% 
  filter(total_effort_1 >= effort_min,
         month >= month_min,
         month <= month_max,
         species_included == "y") %>% 
  collect()

adult_walleye <- in_data %>% 
  #filter for surveys that were good for species abundance
  right_join(good_surveys) %>% 
  collect() 

#creating cpue for species of interest
adult_walleye_cpue <- adult_walleye %>% 
  #grouping by variables to get survey fish count 
  group_by(total_effort_ident) %>% 
  #counts fish of a particular species in a survey 
  mutate(count = sum(species_1 == 'walleye')) %>% 
  #surveys that did not catch fish (species column is na) return a catch of 0
  mutate(count = case_when(nothing_caught == "TRUE" ~ 0,
                           TRUE ~ count)) %>% 
  #generates cpue from counts and efforts associated with that survey count
  mutate(cpue = count/as.numeric(total_effort_1)) %>%
  #collapse data into survey level cpue (also works as a select function)
  distinct(total_effort_ident,
           .keep_all = T)


#checking surveys
good_surveys %>% 
  group_by(survey_type, sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(total_effort_1), max = max(total_effort_1), n = n())

adult_walleye %>% 
  group_by(sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(total_effort_1), 
            max = max(total_effort_1), 
            mean = mean(total_effort_1), 
            n = n()) 

adult_walleye %>% 
  distinct(lake_id,
           sampling_method,
           survey_type,
           total_effort_1,
           total_effort_1_units,
           total_effort_ident,
           effort_min) %>% 
  glimpse()

adult_walleye %>% 
  distinct(total_effort_ident) %>% 
  glimpse()


#range of cpues?
adult_walleye_cpue %>%
  group_by(sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(cpue), max = max(cpue))

#any na cpue?
adult_walleye_cpue %>% 
  filter(is.na(cpue)) %>% 
  glimpse()

#surveys that have nothing caught?
adult_walleye_cpue %>% 
  filter(nothing_caught == "TRUE") %>% 
  group_by(cpue) %>% 
  count()

adult_walleye_cpue %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_smooth(aes(total_effort_1, cpue)) +
  geom_point(aes(total_effort_1, cpue)) +
  facet_wrap(~sampling_method, scales = "free") 

rm(adult_walleye)
```

           month,
           total_effort_1,
           total_effort_1_units,
           total_effort_ident,
           effort_min,
           month_min,
           month_max,
           species_included)%>% 
  filter(total_effort_1 >= effort_min,
         month >= month_min,
         month <= month_max,
         species_included == "y") %>% 
  collect()

adult_yellow_perch <- in_data %>% 
  #filter for surveys that were good for species abundance
  right_join(good_surveys) %>% 
  collect() 

#creating cpue for species of interest
adult_yellow_perch_cpue <- adult_yellow_perch %>% 
  #grouping by variables to get survey fish count 
  group_by(total_effort_ident) %>% 
  #counts fish of a particular species in a survey 
  mutate(count = sum(species_1 == 'yellow_perch')) %>% 
  #surveys that did not catch fish (species column is na) return a catch of 0
  mutate(count = case_when(nothing_caught == "TRUE" ~ 0,
                           TRUE ~ count)) %>% 
  #generates cpue from counts and efforts associated with that survey count
  mutate(cpue = count/as.numeric(total_effort_1)) %>%
  #collapse data into survey level cpue (also works as a select function)
  distinct(total_effort_ident,
           .keep_all = T)


#checking surveys
good_surveys %>% 
  group_by(survey_type, sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(total_effort_1), max = max(total_effort_1), n = n())

adult_yellow_perch %>% 
  group_by(sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(total_effort_1), 
            max = max(total_effort_1), 
            mean = mean(total_effort_1), 
            n = n()) 

adult_yellow_perch %>% 
  group_by(target_species) %>% 
  count()

adult_yellow_perch %>% 
  distinct(lake_id,
           sampling_method,
           survey_type,
           total_effort_1,
           total_effort_1_units,
           total_effort_ident,
           effort_min) %>% 
  glimpse()

adult_yellow_perch %>% 
  distinct(total_effort_ident) %>% 
  glimpse()


#range of cpues?
adult_yellow_perch_cpue %>%
  group_by(sampling_method) %>% 
  summarise(min = min(cpue), max = max(cpue))

#any na cpue?
adult_yellow_perch_cpue %>% 
  filter(is.na(cpue)) %>% 
  glimpse()

#surveys that have nothing caught?
adult_yellow_perch_cpue %>% 
  filter(nothing_caught == "TRUE") %>% 
  group_by(cpue) %>% 
  count()

adult_yellow_perch_cpue %>% 
  ggplot() +
  geom_smooth(aes(total_effort_1, cpue)) +
  geom_point(aes(total_effort_1, cpue)) +
  facet_wrap(~sampling_method, scales = "free") 

rm(adult_yellow_perch)
